comment: This professor is one for the books and not in a good way. The first week joining her class she was extremely unorganized and didn't know how to work any of the online assignments she made. Her content is all over the place and this made it difficult to figure out where the assignments are. You will have to teach her and yourself in this class.
If you care, she cares. Probably one of the best professors I've had. I cant wait to take one of her classes again.

This is my 2nd semester with Dr Smith and she's amazing! I have gotten an A both times I've taken her class. The people who give her bad reviews clearly didn't come to class and do their work. She's very clear about what we need to know and a good lecturer. There are weekly quizzes (open note) but you should be fine if you payed attention in class.

This prof was the most difficult I had in college. She was a tough grader had the smallest complaints about every assignment. 1-2 quizzes a week with lockdown and all exams are lockdown and webcam. Not a lot of homework just a lot of quizzes. Not great at grading either.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Syllabus was inconsistent with what she said.Slow grading,assignments aren't in the grade book,others don't have scores attached to them.Had to take a 2 hour exam,was told it was a participation grade,no content was provided for studying/no study expectation.I got less than the minimum grade she wanted and will now loose points on the assingment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: I don't know why her ratings are so bad. She was honestly a great teacher. My class was 50% online, so all assignments were online. Attendance was around 5-10% of your grade. She was nice and willing to explain/clear any confusion students had. My only complaint was she didn't put in a lot of grades until during Thanksgiving break.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Shes really nice and understanding. These reviews are ODing she's really not bad at all. She'll give you "Hints" on the tests which are very helpful. There are extra credit opportunities as well. People tend to overshare in the class tho so beware. Studying: required

Dr Smith is a great professor despite what all these reviews say. People who left her a bad review clearly did not attend class because everything on the tests and quizzes was outlined and explained in class. She is incredibly knowledgable in the different career paths and was willing to explain anything the class was interested in.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Smith was amazing. It was easy to follow her lectures and she left plenty room for open discussion. The classroom felt very comfortable and she often encouraged conversations. She was also very understanding and patient. I could tell that she was not only a good professor, but a good person.

Legit the worst professor I have ever had DO NOT TAKE HER PLEASE. Listen to all of the bad reviews on this because they are all true. Seriously save yourself a headache and mental breakdowns 24/7 with this class
Don't take her...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She is the toughest grader. She will criticize anything you turn in. Additionally, her tone when communicating isn't pleasant. Other than that, quizzes and exams are extremely easy if you study a normal amount. Due dates are reasonable. The textbook is wonderful, and the class is extremely interesting.

I liked Dr.Smith and found her assignments and lessons to be extremely informative. She is a tough grader, and directions for assignments aren't always clear. I found that she was extremely caring when you asked questions. Tests aren't difficult as long as you study everything. I would definitely take her again!

This professor has lectures that are decent If you take this class Pay extra attention the concepts of the material she gives out real life scenarios to help understand. Grading updates are HORRIBLE you'll make a decent grade the study guide for tests are point less. Understand the concepts in the class and you will be fine. Overall 3/10 class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Smith is A VERY HARD grader. The class was supposed to be hybrid and we took our first exam online with a lockdown browser. she was supposed to release our exam scores a few days after we took it but she didn't and then told us that we would be doing a retake of the exam on a Monday morning class Saturday night.

Absolutely LOVE Dr. Smith. She is amazing to talk to about the course material, and doesn't make you feel behind or unintelligent for not understanding a concept right away. She breaks down difficult concepts easily with examples and is very understanding with life circumstances. One of the best professors I have had to date.

The class itself was fairly easy but she grades very tough on discussion posts. I personally found her very rude on how she responded to emails when I was confused about a lot of things regarding the set up of her class, and makes you feel like an idiot.  There was the same quiz with 3 different names and overall disorganized.

Yeah, all of the other reviews got it right. Extremely open-ended with directions and then an extremely harsh grader. A 100 on a discussion for another class will be a C. All of the lectures she posts are just reading the PowerPoint word-for-word and you pretty much learn nothing. She also has not put in 70% of my grades and it's the last week.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I was pretty surprised to see these ratings. I am taking 2103 online, which may make a big difference. She is very organized, responds to questions, and posts rubrics for grading. The two complaints I have are that her tests are very difficult (not similar to hw and books), and her lectures do not really add anything to the knowledge we already got
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall, a very sloppy professor. The way she had D2L set up made me feel like I didn't know how to use the internet. Weekly quizzes were due at 10 every Friday, unlike every other organized class at KSU. Go back to the class list and find anyone else. If she is the only professor with open spots, there is a reason for that.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: If you're trying to find a good professor for careers in psych, Dr. Smith is not your girl. My entire class had no grades in until the day before the midterm. Every assignment after the midterm was not graded until after the final. Do yourself a favor and take literally anyone else.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I retook this class due to a bad grade before, and Dr. Smith made me like psychology again. There is a quiz every week that comes straight from the textbook. She provides lectures as well, but sometimes they aren't as helpful as the book. If you find yourself taking PSYC2210, take her.

I think a lot of these ratings are way too harsh. Dr. Smith is very chill and nice in my experience. Her lectures are very boring and not very helpful, so I preferred to just take my own notes which wasn't bad. Quizzes are right from the textbook and tests are right from the quizzes. I passed easily in this careers class and she was helpful to me!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I actually took her for 1101 but there wasn't a button for it. By far, one of the absolute worst professors I have ever in my life had. She was harsh, rude, and just flat wrong about so many topics. Her tests disagreed with the textbooks, and her syllabus is sloppy and horrible. If you can take anyone else, RUN!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Just don't. She is a very knowledgeable woman, but lectures are not engaging, course work does not have clear instructions, and overall, very unorganized. She took months to grade assignments, so you won't know your grade until after finals Only two exams, which means you really do not know what content you will be tested on. Unnecessary stress.

Learning content and exam content are not the same. Taught myself the whole class off of powerpoints. Not horrible but not good. Self-driven class. If you can put in the work yourself you should be able to make it.

Nice lady, but not a great professor at all. Gives long, tedious lectures with so much information its impossible to retain it all but the tests require you to retain it all. Does not really care about how students are doing or receiving the material and grades very slow. You wont really know your overall grade until after finals.

Avoid! She is not on top of anything. You will pretty much have a rough guess of your grade mid-semester then figure out what you have AFTER finals. She gets distracted lecturing and she does not respond to emails. She relied on her TA to grade everything, and she also brings up random assignments. A class about careers should not be this difficult
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Does not seem like she cares about how her students are doing at all. Quiz and test questions were EXTREMELY specific and it seemed impossible to memorize everything. Spent many hours studying for the final and still did not do very well. Would never take this class ever again. If you have the chance to take a different teacher, DO IT.

Worst professor I've ever had. First off she makes the UTA grade everything which results in getting grades back insanely late. Extremely unorganized. Almost no feedback on assignments and the feedback that was given was asking for things that weren't in the instructions. Knocked off 20-50 points for things that were never asked for.

The lectures were extremely hard I remember having 100 slide lectures and the tests were so HARD. The tests are unlimited tries however you get the average of all of your test scores. I would not recommend this class whatsoever. If youre a psych major drop this now.

She cares more about the notifications on her Apple Watch than she does about the material, which is frustrating because she teaches some interesting courses. She relies on her UTA to do everything for her, honestly feel bad for the girl. Overall disorganized and loses her train of thought every time she looks down at her wrist, which is a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Honestly if youre a psych major taking this class, you might wanna drop it. This class made me change my entire major from Psych to something else. This is one of the most tedious classes Ive ever had to take. She makes you take a mandatory practice GRE, her reasoning behind it being maybe youll respect grad students more. Sucky class, 2/10
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: AWFUL. She grades projects, some took me 7 hours to do, very tough and specific even though she wasn't specific- grades worth barely any part of ur grade. The rest is quizzes and midterm & final. U can take the quizzes many times bc they are extremely specific to the txt (ex. %). No one did well and the tests were the exact same thing. no curve
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She seemed nice but disorganized. Likes to randomly add assignments at the last minute, even during finals week! Added first round of grades after the midterm then graded nothing till after the final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This is the most unorganized professor iv ever had. We didnt have a calendar so we never knew what was due. She uploads all her assignments TWO DAYS before its due so we have no time. Quizzes and test super hard all on lockdown . She never taught us, powerpoints long and vague (50-92 slides) .BE READY TO HAVE ALOT OF ASSIGNMENTS ON FINALS WEEK.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Avoid! She is the most disorganized professor I have ever had. She takes forever to grade assignments and adds extra assignments randomly throughout the week. For a level 2000 class, the work was beyond more difficult than it should have been. Seriously, avoid this professor.
Dont.

There are many assignments which she grades harshly, weekly quizzes which are 30 questions and you only get 20 mins to take them as well as other assignments due weekly, overly difficult tests. She doesn't actually teach, she just posts PowerPoints which are extremely vague and you have to do further research aside from PowerPoints to learn.

This class was the most unnecessarily difficult class I've ever taken. The content is not difficult, but she made it so. She often set up quizzes incorrectly so even if you picked the right answer it came up as wrong Hides things all over D2L. In the syllabus she had "If you don't include this sentence in your essay, you won't get full credit"

Don't take this class unless you are fine with paying for a class where you teach yourself. Iv never been assigned so much reading in a college class. Her quizzes and tests are very hard and on lockdown browser. She also does not post a semester calendar so its hard to keep up with whats due in the class.

Professor Smith's class was easy, but boring. Class was filled with a lot of talk off topic, very general ideas, nothing too difficult. Tests are online and lack a sense of direction, which seems to be a common theme tied to her entire class. Overall, it was worth taking because of the easiness, but definitely a teacher that will put you to sleep.

Awful professor. Doesn't post assignments regularly. She expects you check d2l twice a day to keep up with her random decision to give you a paper. Shes easy but trust me youll miss assignments. This class ruined my perfect GPA. No point in going to class. She doesn't talk about the book. she just asks you questions to think about
Easy class. She's very unorganized and unclear. However, I would take her again because she didn't try to overcomplicate the class. It's a lot of material. She kept it simple.

Her personality is very high school drama queen. Her lectures are boring and she doesn't add much to class discussions. There are weekly assignments which aren't too hard. All tests are online. The end of the semester is taught by student group presentations.

Really nice and approachable. Lot so assignments that aren't too hard, with the couple exceptions. Tests were a bit challenging because of essays. If you've already been researching grad schools and careers this class is easy. She keeps it real. Attendance can make the difference between your 89 and an A in the class if you've shown effort.

Talks a lot and makes very clear points. Is very useful and this course is definitely helpful in determining what you want to do after college. The assignments, although they require a lot of work, are beneficial and she marks relatively easy.

This class was a a bit of a lackluster experience. Dr. Smith is intelligent and does a great job answering questions. The class is mostly discussion based (derived from assigned readings in the text). All tests were online and required deep understanding of the text. Assignments include a weekly analysis of the reading and one short research paper.
Professor Smith knew her material and she made the class intersting with the discussions. The class was primarily discussions and a paper with tests. The class I took was a hybrid.
